page.title: 17THATCHING IN ESSEX part 1
page.content: Thatching tools are{traditional and have not changed for centuries. Some have odd names like{leggets, {drifts}and{biddles.}Only a few blacksmiths in the country make the edge tools,so they are difficult to get. The traditional{roof patterns}are cut out of straw with a sharp knife. Each thatcher usually has one pattern as his trademark.In Essex the usual thatching material is called{Long {Straw.}This is wheat straw that has been threshed and not cut by combine harvester. A roof that has been thatched with straw should last for{15}to{25 {years.}However the amount of nitrogen {fertiliser}used on the fields these days has{weakened}the{straw,}and this means that the roof needs rethatching more often......(cont.page 18)
